definitions: horse race with obstacles including fences and water jumps
athletics race with barriers and water obstacles similar to hurdles
examples: The Grand National is Britain's most famous steeplechase
Her horse won the steeplechase despite falling at the first fence
He competed in the steeplechase at the college championships
The Olympic steeplechase requires runners to clear water jumps

definitions: castrated male bovine animal raised for beef production
act of guiding or directing movement of a vehicle
examples: The farmer raised steers for the local market
They bought fifty head of steer last spring
Give the wheel a gentle steer to the left
The captain's steer kept us on course

definitions: cheapest passenger accommodation on a ship, typically below deck
act or practice of steering a ship or vehicle
examples: His grandparents traveled to America in steerage class
Steerage passengers endured cramped conditions during the voyage
The steerage of the vessel required constant attention
Poor steerage caused the ship to drift off course

definitions: mechanical system for controlling the direction of a vehicle
act of guiding or directing something toward a goal
examples: The car's steering felt loose and unresponsive
Power steering makes parking much easier
The committee's steering of the project was exemplary
Careful steering through the negotiations led to success

definitions: large mug typically made of stoneware used for drinking beer
surname of German or Jewish origin
examples: He raised his stein to toast the Oktoberfest celebration
The decorative stein held a full liter of beer
Professor Stein taught philosophy at the university
The Stein family moved here from Munich

definitions: main structural part of a plant supporting leaves and flowers
thin vertical part of an object like a glass or pipe
base form of a word before inflections or affixes
examples: The rose stem had several thorns along its length
Cut the stems at an angle before arranging flowers
The wine glass broke at the stem
He cleaned the pipe stem with a special brush
The stem 'walk' appears in walking, walked, and walker
Understanding word stems helps with vocabulary building

definitions: extremely unpleasant and offensive smell that is strong and persistent
examples: The stench from the garbage was overwhelming
A terrible stench filled the room after the pipe burst
The stench of corruption pervaded the entire organization
They couldn't escape the stench of failure

definitions: thin sheet with cut-out designs for applying patterns or text
design or lettering produced using a stencil template
examples: She used a stencil to paint letters on the sign
The artist created intricate designs with brass stencils
The stencil on the wall showed a beautiful floral pattern
Military crates often have stenciled identification numbers

definitions: person trained in shorthand who transcribes spoken words into written form
examples: The court stenographer recorded every word of the testimony
She worked as a stenographer before becoming a paralegal
The stenographer typed at incredible speed during the deposition
They hired a stenographer for the board meeting

definitions: small tube inserted into a blood vessel or duct to keep it open
examples: The doctor placed a stent in his blocked artery
After the stent procedure, blood flow improved significantly
The cardiac stent prevented another heart attack
She recovered quickly from the stent insertion surgery

definitions: single movement of foot in walking or running
flat surface of a stair for placing the foot
one action in a sequence toward achieving something
specific movement or pattern in dancing
examples: She took a careful step on the icy sidewalk
The baby's first steps brought tears of joy
The bottom step creaked under his weight
Stone steps led up to the temple entrance
The first step is admitting there's a problem
Each step in the recipe must be followed precisely
She mastered the basic salsa steps quickly
The dance instructor demonstrated the new step

definitions: son of one's stepparent from a previous relationship
examples: His stepbrother moved in after their parents married
She grew close to her stepbrother over the years
The two stepbrothers shared a room in the new house
My stepbrother is older than me by three years

definitions: daughter of one's spouse from a previous relationship
examples: He treated his stepdaughter as his own child
Her stepdaughter was finishing college next year
The stepdaughter struggled to accept her new family
My stepdaughter and I bonded over shared interests

definitions: man who is married to one's mother but not one's biological father
examples: Her stepfather walked her down the aisle at the wedding
His stepfather taught him how to drive
The stepfather adopted the children after five years
My stepfather has been in my life since childhood

definitions: woman who is married to one's father but not one's biological mother
examples: The stepmother worked hard to build trust with the children
His stepmother attended all his school events
Fairy tales often portray stepmothers negatively
My stepmother became my closest confidant

definitions: vast flat grassland in eastern Europe and Asia with few trees
examples: Nomadic tribes roamed the Mongolian steppe for centuries
The Russian steppe stretches for thousands of miles
Wild horses galloped across the open steppe
The steppe climate features hot summers and cold winters

definitions: fitness equipment simulating stair climbing for cardiovascular exercise
precision motor that moves in discrete steps for accurate positioning
examples: She used the stepper for thirty minutes every morning
The gym's stepper machine provided an intense workout
The 3D printer uses stepper motors for precise movement
Stepper motors control the telescope's tracking system

definitions: daughter of one's stepparent from a previous relationship
examples: Her stepsister became her best friend over time
The two stepsisters shared similar interests in music
My stepsister lives with her biological father
The stepsisters organized a surprise party together

definitions: son of one's spouse from a previous relationship
examples: He coached his stepson's baseball team every summer
Her stepson graduated from medical school last year
The stepson struggled with the new family dynamics
My stepson calls me by my first name

definitions: electronic equipment for playing recorded music with two channels
method of sound reproduction using two or more channels
examples: The vintage stereo still produced excellent sound quality
She turned up the stereo to enjoy her favorite album
The concert was recorded in stereo for better depth
Stereo sound creates a more immersive listening experience

definitions: oversimplified and fixed idea about a particular group or thing
printing plate cast from a mold of composed type
examples: The movie reinforced harmful stereotypes about teenagers
She challenged stereotypes through her groundbreaking work
The old newspaper used stereotype plates for printing
Stereotype printing was common before modern methods

definitions: medical procedure to permanently prevent reproduction in humans or animals
process of making something completely free from bacteria or microorganisms
examples: The veterinarian recommended sterilisation for the cat
Sterilisation is a permanent form of birth control
Hospital equipment undergoes thorough sterilisation between uses
The sterilisation process uses high-temperature steam

definitions: biological inability to produce offspring or conceive children
state of being completely free from living microorganisms
examples: The couple sought treatment for unexplained sterility
Male sterility can have various medical causes
Maintaining sterility in the operating room is crucial
The lab ensured complete sterility of all instruments

definitions: medical procedure to permanently prevent reproduction in humans or animals
process of making something completely free from bacteria or microorganisms
examples: She chose sterilization after having three children
Pet sterilization helps control animal populations
Sterilization of surgical tools prevents infection
The autoclave ensures proper sterilization of equipment

definitions: silver alloy containing 92.5 percent pure silver
British pound as the basic monetary unit
something of excellent quality or genuine worth
examples: The sterling silver necklace was a family heirloom
Sterling requires regular polishing to maintain its shine
The price was fifty pounds sterling
Sterling remained strong against the dollar
Her sterling reputation opened many doors
He gave a sterling performance in the lead role

definitions: rear part of a ship or boat opposite to the bow
examples: The captain stood at the stern watching the sunset
Waves crashed over the stern during the storm
The ship's name was painted on the stern
They installed new lights at the stern

definitions: long flat bone in the center of the chest connecting the ribs
examples: The impact fractured his sternum in the accident
CPR compressions are performed on the lower sternum
The surgeon made an incision along the sternum
Her sternum was sore after the intense workout

definitions: organic compound including hormones like testosterone and cortisol
synthetic substance used illegally to enhance athletic performance
examples: The doctor prescribed steroids to reduce inflammation
Natural steroids are produced by the adrenal glands
Athletes caught using steroids face suspension
Steroid abuse can cause serious health problems

definitions: medical instrument for listening to sounds inside the body especially heart and lungs
examples: The doctor placed the stethoscope on the patient's chest
Every medical student needs a quality stethoscope
She could hear the baby's heartbeat through the stethoscope
The stethoscope detected an irregular heart rhythm

definitions: dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid
state of anxiety or agitation about something
examples: The beef stew simmered for hours on the stove
She made a hearty vegetable stew for dinner
He was in a stew about the upcoming exam
Don't get in a stew over minor problems

definitions: person who serves passengers on an aircraft or ship
person who manages property or affairs for another
official who helps organize a public event
examples: The steward brought drinks to first-class passengers
Ship stewards ensured passenger comfort throughout the voyage
The estate steward managed the property for decades
He served as steward of the family fortune
Race stewards monitored the track for safety
The steward directed people to their seats

definitions: careful and responsible management of something entrusted to one's care
examples: Environmental stewardship protects resources for future generations
His stewardship of the company led to record profits
The foundation practices good stewardship of donor funds
Land stewardship involves sustainable farming practices

definitions: thin piece of wood from a tree or bush
implement used in sports like hockey or lacrosse
solid bar form of a substance like glue or deodorant
examples: The dog fetched the stick from the lake
They gathered sticks to start a campfire
His hockey stick broke during the championship game
She bought a new lacrosse stick for the season
Apply the glue stick evenly across the paper
The deodorant stick lasted for two months

definitions: small piece of paper or plastic with adhesive backing
label showing the price of an item
examples: Children love collecting colorful stickers for their albums
She placed a sticker on her laptop cover
The sticker price was higher than expected
Remove the price sticker before gifting

definitions: person who is excessively formal or lacks flexibility
slang term for a dead body or corpse
examples: Don't be such a stiff at the party
The board members were all stiffs in suits
The detective examined the stiff at the crime scene
They found a stiff in the abandoned warehouse

definitions: material added to fabric or structure to make it rigid
process of becoming rigid or less flexible
examples: The collar needs stiffening to hold its shape
She added stiffening to the hat brim
The stiffening of regulations made business difficult
Gradual stiffening of joints occurs with age

definitions: sensation of being unable to breathe freely due to heat or lack of air
act of preventing something from happening or developing
examples: The stifling heat made outdoor work impossible
The stifling atmosphere in the room was unbearable
The stifling of creativity hampered innovation
Government stifling of dissent sparked protests

definitions: mark of disgrace associated with a particular circumstance or quality
part of a flower pistil that receives pollen
visible sign or characteristic of a disease
examples: Mental health stigma prevents many from seeking help
The stigma of bankruptcy followed him for years
Pollen grains adhere to the flower's stigma
The stigma must be receptive for fertilization
The stigmata appeared as red marks on the skin
Physical stigma of the disease was clearly visible

definitions: action of regarding or treating someone as worthy of disgrace or disapproval
examples: Stigmatization of mental illness must end
The stigmatization of poverty affects children's education
Media stigmatization of certain groups perpetuates prejudice
They fought against the stigmatization of their community

definitions: woman's shoe with a very high thin heel
small dagger with a slender tapering blade
examples: She wore red stilettos to the gala event
Walking in stilettos requires practice and balance
The Renaissance stiletto was a concealed weapon
The assassin carried a stiletto in his boot

definitions: birth of a baby who has died in the womb after 20 weeks of pregnancy
examples: The hospital provided counseling after the stillbirth
Stillbirth affects one in every 160 pregnancies
Research into stillbirth causes continues to advance
Support groups help families cope with stillbirth

definitions: pole with a rest for the foot used for walking above ground
post or pillar supporting a building above ground or water
long-legged wading bird found in wetlands
examples: Children learned to walk on stilts at the circus
The performer balanced on twelve-foot stilts
Houses on stilts protect against flooding
The pier rested on concrete stilts
The black-necked stilt waded through the marsh
Stilts feed on small fish and invertebrates

definitions: drug or substance that increases activity of the nervous system
something that encourages or promotes activity or growth
examples: Caffeine is a mild stimulant found in coffee
The doctor prescribed stimulants for ADHD treatment
Tax cuts served as a stimulant for the economy
Competition acts as a stimulant for innovation

definitions: action of raising levels of physiological or nervous activity
interesting and exciting quality that encourages development
examples: Electrical stimulation helped restore muscle function
The drug causes stimulation of the central nervous system
Children need mental stimulation to develop properly
The job lacked intellectual stimulation

definitions: wound from an insect's stinger injecting venom
sharp tingling pain or burning sensation
undercover police operation to catch criminals
examples: The bee sting swelled immediately
She applied ice to the wasp sting
The sting of the cold wind made her eyes water
He felt the sting of rejection
The drug sting resulted in multiple arrests
Police ran a sting operation at the warehouse

definitions: sharp organ used by insects to inject venom
cutting or painful remark that hurts someone
examples: The scorpion's stinger contains potent venom
Bees die after using their stinger
Her final comment was a real stinger
He delivered a stinger about their past failures

definitions: sharp burning pain like from an insect sting or irritant
sharply critical or hurtful quality of words or actions
examples: The stinging sensation lasted for hours
Stinging nettles caused a painful rash
His stinging rebuke left her speechless
The review contained stinging criticism

definitions: flat-bodied cartilaginous fish with a venomous barbed tail
examples: The stingray glided gracefully across the ocean floor
Divers spotted a massive stingray near the reef
Stingray injuries occur when people step on them
The aquarium's stingray exhibit allows gentle touching

definitions: strong unpleasant smell that is offensive
angry complaint or fuss about something
examples: The stink from the drain was unbearable
There was a terrible stink in the basement
They raised a stink about the new policy
Don't make a stink over such a small issue

definitions: fixed period of time spent doing a particular job
limitation or restriction on resources or effort
examples: Her stint as CEO lasted three years
He did a brief stint in the military
Don't stint on quality ingredients
They put no stint on the celebration expenses
